storyTitle: As HR Manager, I want to receive confirmation messages after shift template operations to achieve clear feedback

testCases.title: Verify success message displays after shift template creation
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager
User has permissions to create shift templates
User is on the shift template management page
All required fields for shift template creation are available

steps.action: Navigate to the shift template creation page
steps.expectedResult: Shift template creation form is displayed with all required fields

steps.action: Fill in all required fields (template name, shift hours, break times, etc.)
steps.expectedResult: All fields accept valid input and display entered data correctly

steps.action: Click the 'Create' or 'Save' button to submit the shift template
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and submits the data

steps.action: Observe the notification area for confirmation message
steps.expectedResult: A clear success message is displayed (e.g., 'Shift template created successfully') within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the message content and visibility
steps.expectedResult: Message is clearly visible, uses appropriate color coding (green for success), and contains specific details about the created template

postconditions: New shift template is saved in the system
Success message is visible to the user
User can proceed with other operations
Template appears in the shift template list

testCases.title: Verify success message displays after shift template update
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager
User has permissions to edit shift templates
At least one shift template exists in the system
User is on the shift template management page

steps.action: Select an existing shift template from the list
steps.expectedResult: Shift template details are displayed

steps.action: Click the 'Edit' button or icon
steps.expectedResult: Shift template edit form opens with current values populated

steps.action: Modify one or more fields (e.g., change shift hours, update template name)
steps.expectedResult: Modified fields accept the new input and display changes

steps.action: Click the 'Update' or 'Save Changes' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the update request

steps.action: Observe the notification area for confirmation message
steps.expectedResult: A clear success message is displayed (e.g., 'Shift template updated successfully') within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the updated template reflects the changes
steps.expectedResult: Template list shows the updated information

postconditions: Shift template is updated with new values
Success message is displayed and visible
Changes are persisted in the database
User remains on the template management page

testCases.title: Verify success message displays after shift template deletion
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager
User has permissions to delete shift templates
At least one shift template exists that can be deleted
User is on the shift template management page

steps.action: Locate a shift template to delete from the list
steps.expectedResult: Shift template is visible in the list with delete option available

steps.action: Click the 'Delete' button or icon for the selected template
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog appears asking to confirm deletion

steps.action: Click 'Confirm' or 'Yes' in the confirmation dialog
steps.expectedResult: System processes the deletion request

steps.action: Observe the notification area for confirmation message
steps.expectedResult: A clear success message is displayed (e.g., 'Shift template deleted successfully') within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the template is removed from the list
steps.expectedResult: Deleted template no longer appears in the shift template list

postconditions: Shift template is permanently deleted from the system
Success message is displayed to the user
Template list is updated to reflect the deletion
User can continue with other operations

testCases.title: Verify descriptive error message displays when shift template creation fails due to missing required fields
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager
User has permissions to create shift templates
User is on the shift template creation page

steps.action: Navigate to the shift template creation form
steps.expectedResult: Creation form is displayed with all fields

steps.action: Leave one or more required fields empty (e.g., template name)
steps.expectedResult: Fields remain empty

steps.action: Click the 'Create' or 'Save' button
steps.expectedResult: System validates the form

steps.action: Observe the notification area and form validation
steps.expectedResult: A descriptive error message is displayed (e.g., 'Template name is required') with clear indication of which fields are missing

steps.action: Verify the error message provides actionable guidance
steps.expectedResult: Error message uses appropriate color coding (red), specifies the exact issue, and guides user on how to fix it

postconditions: No shift template is created
User remains on the creation form
Error message is clearly visible
Form data is retained for correction

testCases.title: Verify descriptive error message displays when shift template update fails due to validation errors
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager
User has permissions to edit shift templates
At least one shift template exists in the system
User is on the shift template edit page

steps.action: Open an existing shift template for editing
steps.expectedResult: Edit form is displayed with current values

steps.action: Enter invalid data in one or more fields (e.g., negative shift hours, invalid time format)
steps.expectedResult: Invalid data is entered in the field

steps.action: Click the 'Update' or 'Save Changes' button
steps.expectedResult: System validates the input

steps.action: Observe the notification area for error message
steps.expectedResult: A descriptive error message is displayed (e.g., 'Shift hours must be a positive number') clearly indicating the validation issue

steps.action: Verify the error message provides specific details
steps.expectedResult: Error message specifies which field has the issue and what the valid format or range should be

postconditions: Shift template is not updated
User remains on the edit form
Error message is visible with actionable details
Original template data remains unchanged

testCases.title: Verify descriptive error message displays when shift template deletion fails due to dependencies
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager
User has permissions to delete shift templates
A shift template exists that is currently in use or has dependencies
User is on the shift template management page

steps.action: Locate a shift template that has active dependencies (e.g., assigned to employees or schedules)
steps.expectedResult: Template is visible in the list

steps.action: Click the 'Delete' button for the template
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog appears

steps.action: Confirm the deletion action
steps.expectedResult: System attempts to process the deletion

steps.action: Observe the notification area for error message
steps.expectedResult: A descriptive error message is displayed (e.g., 'Cannot delete template: currently assigned to 5 employees') explaining why deletion failed

steps.action: Verify the error message provides actionable guidance
steps.expectedResult: Error message suggests next steps (e.g., 'Remove assignments before deleting') and uses appropriate error styling

postconditions: Shift template is not deleted
Template remains in the system with all dependencies intact
Error message is clearly displayed
User can take corrective action based on the message

testCases.title: Verify error message displays when network or server error occurs during shift template operation
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager
User has permissions to perform shift template operations
Network connectivity issues or server error condition can be simulated
User is on the shift template management page

steps.action: Initiate any shift template operation (create, update, or delete)
steps.expectedResult: Operation form or confirmation is displayed

steps.action: Simulate network disconnection or server error (e.g., disconnect network, simulate 500 error)
steps.expectedResult: Network or server becomes unavailable

steps.action: Submit the operation
steps.expectedResult: System attempts to process the request

steps.action: Observe the notification area for error message
steps.expectedResult: A descriptive error message is displayed (e.g., 'Unable to connect to server. Please check your connection and try again') within a reasonable timeout period

steps.action: Verify the error message provides helpful guidance
steps.expectedResult: Error message explains the issue clearly and suggests troubleshooting steps

postconditions: Operation is not completed
Error message is displayed with clear explanation
User can retry the operation once connectivity is restored
No partial data is saved

testCases.title: Verify confirmation messages are accessible and comply with WCAG standards
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager
Screen reader software is available for testing
User has permissions to perform shift template operations
Accessibility testing tools are configured

steps.action: Enable screen reader software (e.g., NVDA, JAWS)
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader is active and functioning

steps.action: Perform a shift template creation operation
steps.expectedResult: Template is created successfully

steps.action: Listen to the screen reader announcement of the success message
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces the success message clearly and completely with appropriate ARIA labels

steps.action: Verify the message has proper ARIA attributes (role='alert' or role='status')
steps.expectedResult: Message container has appropriate ARIA attributes for accessibility

steps.action: Check color contrast ratio of the message using accessibility tools
steps.expectedResult: Message text has sufficient contrast ratio (minimum 4.5:1 for normal text) meeting WCAG AA standards

steps.action: Navigate to the message using keyboard only (Tab key)
steps.expectedResult: Message is keyboard accessible and can be focused if interactive

steps.action: Verify message remains visible for adequate time or can be dismissed
steps.expectedResult: Message stays visible long enough to be read (minimum 5 seconds) or has a dismiss button

postconditions: All confirmation messages meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards
Messages are fully accessible via screen readers
Keyboard navigation works properly
Color contrast requirements are met

testCases.title: Verify error messages are accessible and comply with WCAG standards
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager
Screen reader software is available for testing
User has permissions to perform shift template operations
Accessibility testing tools are configured

steps.action: Enable screen reader software
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader is active

steps.action: Trigger an error condition (e.g., submit form with missing required fields)
steps.expectedResult: Error condition is triggered

steps.action: Listen to the screen reader announcement of the error message
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces the error message with appropriate urgency and clarity, including ARIA live region announcements

steps.action: Verify error message has proper ARIA attributes (role='alert', aria-live='assertive')
steps.expectedResult: Error message container has appropriate ARIA attributes for immediate announcement

steps.action: Check color contrast of error message text and icons
steps.expectedResult: Error message meets WCAG contrast requirements (4.5:1 minimum) and does not rely solely on color to convey meaning

steps.action: Verify error message is associated with the relevant form field using aria-describedby
steps.expectedResult: Error message is programmatically linked to the field that caused the error

steps.action: Navigate to error message and associated fields using keyboard only
steps.expectedResult: All error elements are keyboard accessible and focus is managed appropriately

postconditions: All error messages meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards
Error messages are fully accessible via assistive technologies
Error indication does not rely solely on color
Keyboard users can access and understand all error information

testCases.title: Verify notification messages comply with UI design standards and consistency
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager
User has permissions to perform shift template operations
UI design standards documentation is available
User is on the shift template management page

steps.action: Perform a shift template creation and observe the success notification
steps.expectedResult: Success notification appears with consistent styling (color, font, size, position)

steps.action: Verify the notification uses the standard success color (typically green) and icon
steps.expectedResult: Notification uses consistent success indicators matching UI standards

steps.action: Perform a shift template update and observe the success notification
steps.expectedResult: Update notification has the same styling, position, and format as creation notification

steps.action: Trigger an error condition and observe the error notification
steps.expectedResult: Error notification uses consistent error styling (typically red) with appropriate icon

steps.action: Verify notification positioning is consistent across all operations
steps.expectedResult: All notifications appear in the same location (e.g., top-right corner, top of page)

steps.action: Check that notification text follows consistent formatting and tone
steps.expectedResult: All messages use consistent language style, capitalization, and punctuation

steps.action: Verify notification dismiss behavior is consistent (auto-dismiss or manual close)
steps.expectedResult: All notifications have the same dismiss mechanism and timing

postconditions: All notifications follow UI design standards
Consistent styling is maintained across all message types
User experience is uniform across all operations
Notifications meet brand and design guidelines

testCases.title: Verify notification messages use modal dialogs appropriately for critical operations
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager
User has permissions to perform shift template operations
User is on the shift template management page

steps.action: Initiate a shift template deletion operation
steps.expectedResult: Delete button is clicked

steps.action: Observe if a modal dialog appears for confirmation
steps.expectedResult: Modal dialog appears asking for deletion confirmation, blocking other interactions

steps.action: Verify the modal contains clear messaging about the action consequences
steps.expectedResult: Modal displays warning message explaining that deletion is permanent or has specific consequences

steps.action: Confirm the deletion in the modal
steps.expectedResult: Modal closes and success notification appears

steps.action: Perform a non-critical operation like template creation
steps.expectedResult: Success notification appears as inline notification or toast, not as modal

steps.action: Verify that modal dialogs are used only for operations requiring explicit confirmation
steps.expectedResult: Modal dialogs are reserved for critical actions (delete, bulk operations), while inline notifications are used for standard operations

postconditions: Modal dialogs are used appropriately for critical operations
Inline notifications are used for standard feedback
User interaction patterns are intuitive and consistent
Critical operations require explicit confirmation

testCases.title: Verify notification messages use inline notifications appropriately for standard operations
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager
User has permissions to perform shift template operations
User is on the shift template management page

steps.action: Create a new shift template
steps.expectedResult: Template creation form is submitted successfully

steps.action: Observe the type of notification displayed
steps.expectedResult: An inline notification or toast message appears (not a modal dialog) showing success message

steps.action: Verify the inline notification does not block user interaction with the page
steps.expectedResult: User can continue interacting with the page while notification is visible

steps.action: Update an existing shift template
steps.expectedResult: Template update is submitted successfully

steps.action: Observe the notification type for update operation
steps.expectedResult: Inline notification appears with update success message, allowing continued page interaction

steps.action: Verify the notification auto-dismisses after appropriate time or has a close button
steps.expectedResult: Notification either disappears automatically after 5-10 seconds or provides a close/dismiss button

steps.action: Check that inline notifications appear in a consistent location
steps.expectedResult: All inline notifications appear in the same designated area (e.g., top-right corner, banner area)

postconditions: Inline notifications are used for standard operations
User workflow is not interrupted by notifications
Notifications are dismissible or auto-dismiss
Consistent notification placement is maintained
